instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on but bank screen
threads.message:
Hey guys. New here
So I fix MacBooks as a hobby and this is probably my 30th one and I’m stumped

<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBook 13 inch powers on. You can verify by the caps lock which is green.
Plug her on charge and you hear a charge sound, [B]but that’s where the good ends by[/B]
[LIST]
[*]the screen stays blank. No low brightness issues (I’ve shined a light and nothing shows on screen)
[*]Opening up the unit which shows signs of corrosion but nothing detrimental
[/LIST]

not sure where to go from here

maybe some of the pros can assist?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on but bank screen
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on but bank screen
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Do you get external video?
Test disconnecting internal LCD.
Also check for USB activity.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on but bank screen
threads.message:
Ok so testing this morning - external screen seems to be working fine (GREAT) - flashing folder with question mark has appeared (not too worried about that)

but the question is, what could be causing the internal screen to not emit any video ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on but bank screen
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers on but bank screen
threads.message: ok so ofcourse we found the problem - the tcon board connector for the lcd is burnt from Flexgate issues - sigh - we gotta replace the female connector on the tcon and replace the backlight cable
